messages.subject: Re: Re: International Day of Returns
messages.msgSnippet: Well, isn t modified boxing what you have to be expert in to do returns on 12/26  Lynda, thinking maybe that is where that name came from
messages.messageBody:
Well, isn't modified "boxing" what you have to be expert in to do returns
on 12/26 <<<BEWG>>>

Lynda, thinking maybe that is where that name came from <g>

----------
> From: David Albert <shantinik@...>
>
> Shay Seaborne wrote:
>
> > From: Shay Seaborne <s-seaborne@...>
> >
> > <<<the day after International Buy Nothing Day is hereby dubbed
> > "International Day of Returns".>>>
> >
> > I thought that was the reason for December 26. <EG>
> >
> > -Shay
>
> That's "Boxing Day" (I went to school in England.) Besides, not all of
> us celebrate Christmas, but "ALL" go shopping after Thanksgiving!
>
> David

David

Month.

David

messages.messageBody:
NO wait I am not done returning
Can we have a week ...please!?
SOS.....With all her returns in one box---I am trying!
----- Original Message -----

To: <Unschooling-dotcom@onelist.com>; <chris@...>;
<NoClass@onelist.com>; <huuh-l@...>; Patrick Farenga
<Patrick129@...>

Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] International Day of Returns

messages.subject: International Day of Returns
messages.msgSnippet: Well, I think we have just invented a new holiday!!!! Some simple living/anti-consumerism advocates have dubbed the day after Thanksgiving International Buy
messages.messageBody:
Well, I think we have just invented a new holiday!!!!

Some "simple living/anti-consumerism" advocates have dubbed the day
after Thanksgiving "International Buy Nothing Day". Well, for those of
us who are not there yet, the day after International Buy Nothing Day is
hereby dubbed "International Day of Returns".

Let's start a movement!

David Albert
